messages.subject: Re: Answering "Those" comments
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks! I actually did print it and I shall keep it for a reminder on those less-than-perfect days.
messages.messageBody:
Thanks! I actually did print it and I shall keep it for a reminder on those
less-than-perfect days.

messages.subject: Re: Answering "Those" comments
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 99-09-20 17:47:18 EDT, you write:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 99-09-20 17:47:18 EDT, you write:

<<
Print this up real purty' and have it laminated. Then you can show it to
those who question you.

"This card entitles the bearer to:
Homeschool their children to the best of their knowledge and ability;
Live a full, happy and enriching family life complete with love,
laughter and learning;
Not have to apologize for their lifestyle or beliefs;
Disregard the judgements and pronouncements of uninformed persons;
Not be a mouthpiece or mobile public educator about the subject of
Homeschooling, unless they WANT to
Not have to prove themselves worthy as parents or Homeschoolers to every
(well meaning or otherwise) person
who questions them.

Card Bearer ______________________ Signature__________________________

Nanci K. in Idaho

>>
That is halarious!!!!

Thank you!

Rachael

messages.subject: Re: Answering "Those" comments
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/20/99 4:47:22 PM EST, tn-k4of5@if.rmci.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/20/99 4:47:22 PM EST, tn-k4of5@... writes:

<< Print this up real purty' and have it laminated. Then you can show it to
those who question you. >>
Nanci,
That is real good! I think we should also have printed and laminated the
national home schooler week page, with all its where as 's!!
Teresa

messages.subject: Re: Answering "Those" comments
messages.msgSnippet: I can t get it out of my ... Print this up real purty and have it laminated.  Then you can show it to those who question you. This card entitles the bearer
messages.messageBody:
I can't get it out of my
>head that we need to have something to show for our days at home when my
>parents come over or we meet people at the store or at sports events who
>question homeschooling.
>
>Olivia

Print this up real purty' and have it laminated. Then you can show it to
those who question you.

"This card entitles the bearer to:
Homeschool their children to the best of their knowledge and ability;
Live a full, happy and enriching family life complete with love,
laughter and learning;
Not have to apologize for their lifestyle or beliefs;
Disregard the judgements and pronouncements of uninformed persons;
Not be a mouthpiece or mobile public educator about the subject of
Homeschooling, unless they WANT to
Not have to prove themselves worthy as parents or Homeschoolers to every
(well meaning or otherwise) person
who questions them.

Card Bearer ______________________ Signature__________________________

Nanci K. in Idaho
